title: London Fletcher's name misspelled on video board at Redskins ring of fame induction
text:
The Washington Redskins inducted linebacker London Fletcher and tackle Chris Samuels into the Redskins Ring of Fame during Monday’s game against the Chicago Bears.

The ceremony itself was not without a snafu, in the middle of a 31-15 loss full of ugly moments.

Fletcher’s name included a typo while displayed on the video board at FedEx Field, having it say FLECTHER.

Some eagle-eyed fans at the game noticed and took photos for social media, where personalities like PFT Commenter did the rest.

Congrat’s to London Flecther on his induction into the ring of honor. A Franchise Committed to telling not spelling pic.twitter.com/PAhYbzN417 — PFTCommenter (@PFTCommenter) September 24, 2019

What a classy organization. @Redskins can’t even spell their new ring of honor member, London Fletcher’s name right. What a joke starting from the top, Dan Snyder #Redskins #HTTR pic.twitter.com/37yLwfKtFX — The Opening Drive (@OpeningDrive) September 24, 2019

Of course the Skins misspelled London Fletcher’s name during his Ring of Honor ceremony: https://t.co/R8MISdc3h8 pic.twitter.com/OLjqL9MOAA — Deadspin (@Deadspin) September 24, 2019

Between that and another moment where ESPN’s cameras showed an employee stirring a large tub of Gatorade with a sleeve of cups, things weren’t much better off the field for Washington Monday as they were on it.

description: London Fletcher's name included a typo while displayed on the video board at FedEx Field, having it say FLECTHER.
